text: For every minute you remain angry, you give up sixty seconds of peace of mind.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Anger is an acid that can do more harm to the vessel in which it is stored than to anything on which it is poured.
author: Mark Twain

text: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.
author: Buddha

text: Anger makes you smaller, while forgiveness forces you to grow beyond what you were.
author: Cherie Carter-Scott

text: The best fighter is never angry.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Anger is a wind which blows out the lamp of the mind.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

text: When angry, count to ten before you speak. If very angry, count to one hundred.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Anger is never without a reason, but seldom with a good one.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
author: Seneca

text: Anger dwells only in the bosom of fools.
author: Albert Einstein

text: How much trouble he avoids who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Anger is a momentary madness, so control your passion or it will control you.
author: Horace

text: The angry man will defeat himself in battle as well as in life.
author: Samurai Maxim

text: Anger is like a storm rising up from the bottom of your consciousness.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: When you are offended at any man's fault, turn to yourself and study your own failings.
author: Epictetus

text: Anger cannot be dishonest.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The fire you kindle for your enemy often burns yourself more than them.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Anger is an energy that can be transformed into wisdom.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Don't hold to anger, hurt or pain. They steal your energy and keep you from love.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: Anger is a killing thing: it kills the man who angers, for each rage leaves him less than he had been before.
author: Louis L'Amour

text: The opposite of anger is not calmness, it's empathy.
author: Mehmet Oz
